title: Urban Aesthetics & Creative Rebirth
subTitle: 城市美學與文創再生：屏東市一日遊
intro: For travelers who love photography, history, and a relaxed pace. Explore the 'renaissance' of Pingtung City, visiting the top-rated spots of 2025: the Victory Star Village and Heito 1909.
transportation: Take the train to **Pingtung Station (屏東火車站)**, then rent a P-Bike (public bicycle) or take a short taxi ride.

spots.name: Pingtung Public Library (屏東縣立圖書館總館)
spots.address: No. 69, Dalian Rd., Pingtung City, Pingtung County
spots.description: Known as the 'Library in the Forest', this 30-year-old cultural center was transformed into a glass-walled marvel surrounded by a 5-hectare camphor tree forest. It perfectly blends reading with nature.

spots.name: Victory Star Village (勝利星村創意生活園區)
spots.address: No. 106, Qingdao St., Pingtung City, Pingtung County
spots.description: Historically known as the 'General's Village', this is the largest preserved cluster of Japanese-style military dormitories in Taiwan. It ranked No. 1 in 2025 for its vibrant mix of independent bookstores, cafes, and artisan shops.

spots.name: Heito 1909 (屏東縣民公園)
spots.address: Fuxing Rd., Pingtung City, Pingtung County
spots.description: 'Heito' is the old Japanese name for Pingtung. This site was once a restricted paper pulp factory hidden underground for decades. Now, it's a cyberpunk-style park featuring rusty steel structures and industrial ruins.

title: Tribes Above the Clouds: Shenshan Line
subTitle: 雲端上的部落：神山線深度一日遊
intro: Designed for travelers seeking 'cultural authenticity'. This tour takes you deep into the mountains to experience the Rukai and Paiwan tribes using the convenient 'Taiwan Trip 508' bus.
transportation: Take the **Taiwan Trip Bus 508 (Shenshan Line)** from **Pingtung Transfer Station (屏東轉運站)**. *Reservation required.*

spots.name: Guchuan Bridge (谷川大橋)
spots.address: Wutai Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: Standing 99 meters tall (about 33 stories), this is the highest bridge in Taiwan. The pillars are decorated with the 'Hundred-Pacer Snake' pattern, a sacred guardian spirit in Rukai mythology.

spots.name: Wutai Tribe (霧台部落)
spots.address: Yanban Ln., Wutai Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: A Rukai settlement famous for its 'breathing' slate houses built from local black shale. Don't miss the 'Shenshan Aiyu Jelly', a dessert made from wild figs native to Taiwan's high mountains.

spots.name: Rinari Tribe (禮納里部落)
spots.address: Majia Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: Known as the 'Provence of Taiwan', this village features European-style wooden cottages built for the indigenous people after Typhoon Morakot. It offers a unique visual contrast with traditional totem decorations.

title: Faith & Flavors: Peninsula Gateway
subTitle: 信仰與海味：半島入口美食巡禮
intro: A perfect route for families and food lovers, visiting the top-ranking 'Faith Economy' center and enjoying the best seafood in Pingtung.
transportation: Take **Taiwan Trip Bus 9189 (Kenting Express)** from Pingtung Station.

spots.name: Dapeng Bay (大鵬灣遊憩區)
spots.address: No. 631, Dapeng Bay Ring Rd., Donggang Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: Once a Japanese seaplane base during WWII, it is now Taiwan's largest lagoon. The cross-sea bridge puts on a spectacular 'opening show' to let boats pass.

spots.name: Donggang Seafood Market (東港)
spots.address: Donggang Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: Famous for Bluefin Tuna (May-July), known as the 'Porsche of the Sea'. Also try 'Rou-Guo' (肉粿), a savory rice cake soup unique to this town.

spots.name: Checheng Fu'an Temple (車城福安宮)
spots.address: No. 51, Fu'an Rd., Checheng Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: The largest Land God temple in Southeast Asia. It features a unique 'money-counting' furnace that uses aerodynamics to suck joss paper in automatically.

title: Ecological Serenity: Escaping Crowds
subTitle: 國境之南的生態與靜謐
intro: Designed to avoid the commercialized areas, focusing on what international travelers love most: raw nature, marine education, and quiet coastlines.
transportation: Take **Bus 9189 (Kenting Express)** to Hengchun, then use the **Kenting Shuttle (Orange/Blue Line)**.

spots.name: Wanlitong (萬里桐)
spots.address: Wanlitong, Hengchun Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: A quiet fishing village and a top snorkeling spot with rich coral reefs. Unlike crowded beaches, it offers peace and was a filming location for 'Cape No. 7'.

spots.name: Longpan Park (龍磐公園)
spots.address: Provincial Hwy 26, Hengchun Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: A vast limestone tableland with no trees or buildings, offering unobstructed views of the Pacific Ocean. It is a world-class spot for sunrise and stargazing.

spots.name: Eluanbi Lighthouse (鵝鑾鼻燈塔)
spots.address: No. 90, Dengta Rd., Hengchun Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: Known as the 'Light of East Asia'. Built in 1881 (Qing Dynasty) as a fortress to protect against indigenous raids, making it the only armed lighthouse in the world.

title: Time Tunnel: From Military Villages to Hakka Culture
subTitle: 從眷村到客家文化：屏東全域透視 (Day 1)
intro: Part 1 of a comprehensive journey covering the transformation of Pingtung, focusing on the cultural renaissance in the north.
transportation: Car rental is recommended for this 3-day itinerary for maximum flexibility.

spots.name: Heito 1909 (屏東縣民公園)
spots.address: Fuxing Rd., Pingtung City, Pingtung County
spots.description: Witness the transformation of a sugar factory ruin into a modern design masterpiece. The rusty structures tell the story of Pingtung's industrial past.

spots.name: Liudui Hakka Cultural Park (六堆客家文化園區)
spots.address: No. 588, Xinyi Rd., Neipu Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: 'Liudui' refers to the six militia units formed by Hakka people to defend their homes. The park showcases umbrella-shaped solar structures and traditional paper umbrella crafts.

title: Railways, Ocean & Secret Sands
subTitle: 鐵道、海洋與秘境沙灘 (Day 2 & 3)
intro: Continuing south to explore railway history, a world-class aquarium sleepover, and secret nature spots.
transportation: Drive south via Provincial Highway 1 and 26.

spots.name: Chaozhou Railway Park (潮州鐵道園區)
spots.address: Guangfu Rd., Chaozhou Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: The only railway maintenance depot in Taiwan open to tourists. It features 'Giant' train models and offers a peek into the history of Taiwan's railways.

spots.name: Overnight at NMMBA (夜宿海生館)
spots.address: Checheng Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: A bucket-list experience where you sleep in the underwater tunnel, waking up to sharks and rays swimming above you.

spots.name: Fengchuisha (風吹砂)
spots.address: Provincial Hwy 26, Hengchun Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: Meaning 'Wind Blowing Sand'. In winter, strong winds blow sand from the riverbed up the cliffs, creating unique sand dunes on top of the coastal tableland.

title: Offshore Island: Xiao Liuqiu
subTitle: 小琉球：與海龜共游的珊瑚之島
intro: A coral island just a short ferry ride away. Famous for having one of the highest densities of sea turtles in the world. Enjoy a 2-day eco-tour.

spots.name: Vase Rock (花瓶岩)
spots.address: Liuqiu Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: The landmark of Xiao Liuqiu. A perfect spot for snorkeling to see green sea turtles up close in shallow waters.

spots.name: Black Dwarf Cave (烏鬼洞)
spots.address: Liuqiu Township, Pingtung County
spots.description: A limestone cave maze formed by coral reefs. The surrounding coastal boardwalk offers stunning ocean views and sounds of waves.

spots.name: Intertidal Zone (潮間帶生態導覽)
spots.address: Dafuping/Shanfu/Yuchengwei, Liuqiu Township
spots.description: Join a guided tour during low tide to see sea urchins, sea cucumbers, and starfish. A strict 'Look but Don't Touch' policy applies to protect the ecosystem.
